column1: Lou Malnati's Pizzeria////After seeing Lou Malnati's "The Best Thing I Ever Ate" with Chef Ann
column2: my husband and I had to try when we came to Chicago.  We ordered a large pepperoni
column4: thin crust and the first surprise was the price.  We thought
column6: must be Chicago prices...$36.  Since it was going to take about 30 minutes
column7: we had a drink at the bar.  First impression was the place was not very clean.  The servers seemed more into their personal conversations than helping the guests.  We finally got our pizza after 50 minutes and the restaurant was not that busy.  For $36
column8: we were extremely disappointed.  Sauce was bland and crust tasted frozen.  There are much better places in Chicago than Lou Malnati's.  We will not be back.
